title: Pakistan: 23 killed in separate road accidents amid dense fog; 6 children among dead
description: Tragic road accidents in Pakistan claimed at least 23 lives, including six children, on Saturday. A truck plunged into a dry canal in Sargodha, killing 14, while nine perished when a passenger coach overturned near Gwadar. Dense fog and over-speeding are blamed for the devastating incidents, highlighting ongoing traffic safety concerns.

This situation creates a stressful and negative experience for visitors, overshadowing the state's attractions. Ensuring fair and accessible transport is crucial for Goa's tourism.

description: Pakistan stars Babar Azam and Mohammad Rizwan endured a tough BBL 2026, topping the list of the slowest batters with strike rates of 107.48 and 102.74. Babar’s frustration was visible after a mid-pitch clash with Steve Smith, before his dismissal. Rizwan, meanwhile, became the first overseas player in BBL history to be retired out, highlighting concerns over their T20 tempo.

title: ‘Not regular acvtivity’: MEA on why India skiped Brics naval drills; cites IBSAMAR
description: India clarified its non-participation in a recent South African-led naval exercise involving some BRICS nations, stating it was not an official BRICS activity. The Ministry of External Affairs emphasized that the drill was a South African initiative, unlike the regular IBSAMAR exercise India conducts with Brazil and South Africa. India currently chairs the expanded BRICS bloc.

title: Kerala unit of Janata Dal (S) merges with Indian Socialist Janata Dal (ISJD)
description: The Kerala unit of the party, which is an ally of the ruling LDF in the State, had unanimously rejected the decision of its supremo H.D. Deve Gowda to join hands with the BJP ahead of the 2024 Lok Sabha elections.

title: 'If America embraces Indians...': US lawmakers draw sharp India–Pakistan contrast
description: Senior US lawmakers emphasized India's central role in America's Indo-Pacific strategy, highlighting its importance for global stability and strong economic ties. They clarified that routine engagement with Pakistan does not signify a strategic shift, as India remains the primary focus for US investments and partnerships.

He believes regional nations desire stability, suggesting a potential turning point despite limited information access.  Meanwhile, Tharoor expressed skepticism about peace in Gaza, noting ongoing violence.

title: Handshake drama returns! India, Bangladesh captains refuse pleasantries at U-19 World Cup

This follows a pattern seen in previous matches involving Indian teams and Pakistan. Recent political tensions between India and Bangladesh have also impacted cricket, with player releases and security concerns raised.

title: Aadhaar lock/unlock: UIDAI lets users control authentication; step-by-step guide
description: Take charge of your Aadhaar security with the 'Lock/Unlock' feature. This tool allows you to temporarily disable authentication using your Aadhaar number, enhancing privacy. You can still use your Virtual ID for verification. Locking and unlocking can be done easily via the UIDAI website or the mAadhaar app, offering citizens greater control over their sensitive data.

Timely, specialized intervention saved both lives, highlighting the dangers of foreign body aspiration in infants.

title: Watch: Justice D.Y. Chandrachud questions prolonged incarceration in Umar Khalid case | Lit for Life 2026
description: At The Hindu Lit for Life 2026, Justice D.Y. Chandrachud responds to a question on free speech, national security and the Unlawful Activities Prevention Act, referring to the cases of Umar Khalid and Sharjeel Imam. He reflects on the presumption of innocence, the right to a speedy trial, and whether speech alone can be treated as terrorism. Emphasising judicial scrutiny even in national security cases, he warns against undertrial incarceration becoming a form of punishment.

This discovery could aid future conservation efforts.

title: Iran unrest: Over 3,000 killed in nationwide protests; toll deadliest in decades

The protests, initially sparked by economic woes, escalated into widespread challenges against the clerical leadership, drawing international attention and prompting a cautious response from the US.

description: A Bengaluru woman died after setting herself and her four-year-old daughter on fire following a dispute with her husband. The daughter also succumbed to her burns. In a separate incident, a 22-year-old woman was rescued after attempting suicide due to her lover's refusal to marry her.

title: Russian man arrested for killing 2 Russian women
description: Goa police apprehended a Russian man, Alexei Leonov, after his live-in partner was found murdered in Arambol. Investigations revealed a second Russian woman, a mutual friend, was also a victim, with similar methods used in both killings. Witness accounts point to a violent altercation preceding the partner's death, leading to Leonov's escape and subsequent arrest.

title: ‘No entry for non-Hindus’: Har ki Pauri boards cite century-old bylaw; officials say no fresh order
description: New notice boards citing a century-old bylaw restricting non-Hindus at Har-ki-Pauri have been installed by the Ganga Sabha. The body aims to enforce rules framed in 1916, stating only those connected to Sanatan Dharma should enter the holy site. While the Ganga Sabha seeks wider implementation, district officials emphasize that enforcement depends on civic authorities and adherence to the law.

title: Expert reveals why modern students prioritise passion and affordability over popular universities
description: Studying abroad priorities are shifting. Gen Z students now focus on specific courses and professors over university brands. Practical factors like safety and affordability are also key. This thoughtful approach guides their decisions for future careers. Universities must highlight program strengths and faculty expertise to attract these students.

title: Zuckerberg hired Wang for $14bn — now they’re clashing
description: Meta's new structure reveals tension between Mark Zuckerberg and Alexandr Wang, the $14 billion AI recruit. Wang finds Zuckerberg's micromanagement stifling, while staff question his leadership for Meta's AI ambitions. A recent strategy clash highlighted differing priorities, with Wang pushing for cutting-edge AI over immediate product integration.
